perturbation.original_text: EFS agrees that it shall approach Licensees regarding any planned  EFS Produced Merchandise and give such Licensees a seven (7) day right of first refusal with respect to the design and  manufacture thereof, whereby EFS may set forth commercially reasonable requirements with respect to pricing, delivery and  product specifications.
perturbation.changed_text: EFS agrees that it shall approach Licensees regarding any planned  EFS Produced Merchandise and give such Licensees a two (2) day right of first refusal with respect to the design and  manufacture thereof, whereby EFS may set forth commercially reasonable requirements with respect to pricing, delivery and  product specifications.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the right of first refusal period for licensees to 2 days is not commercially reasonable and does not provide a reasonable time frame for the licensee to assess the business opportunity and respond. This may be seen as an attempt to circumvent the licensee's rights and is likely to be deemed unfair/unconscionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing

perturbation.original_text: In the event Client fails to  provide its approval or disapproval of any or all things submitted to Client pursuant to this Section 2.6(d) within fourteen (14)  days of Client's receipt thereof, EFS may send written notice to Client advising no response was received. If Client does not  respond within five (5) days of Client's receipt thereof, then Client shall be deemed to have given disapproval.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event Client fails to  provide its approval or disapproval of any or all things submitted to Client pursuant to this Section 2.6(d) within three (3)  days of Client's receipt thereof, EFS may send written notice to Client advising no response was received. If Client does not  respond within one (1) days of Client's receipt thereof, then Client shall be deemed to have given disapproval.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the time frame of client's approval and disapproval of EFS submissions to three(3) and one(1) day respectively is not commercially reasonable and does not provide a reasonable time frame for the client to assess the business opportunity and respond. This may be seen as an attempt to circumvent the client's rights and is likely to be deemed unfair/unconscionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing

perturbation.original_text: Client agrees that these policies shall not be canceled or materially changed without at least thirty (30) days'  prior written notice to Client. Such notice shall include written confirmation and details of replacement insurance coverages and  other material revisions to the policies, which shall be effective immediately upon any cancellation or material change in EFS'  policies in order that no gap in coverage results.
perturbation.changed_text: Client agrees that these policies shall not be canceled or materially changed without at least five (5) days'  prior written notice to Client. Such notice shall include written confirmation and details of replacement insurance coverages and  other material revisions to the policies, which shall be effective immediately upon any cancellation or material change in EFS'  policies in order that no gap in coverage results.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for insurance cancellation or material change to five (5) days is not commercially reasonable and does not provide a reasonable time frame for the client to arrange for other insurance policies. This may be seen as an attempt to circumvent the client's rights and is likely to be deemed unfair/unconscionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing
